Can you make it work with NDS games? Edit: Yeah i tried another patch file and it worked. Though i don't know why a some patches come in NMP files. Is there any way to patch files with NMP on android? Edit: Thanks for responding.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Unfortunately I don't know any programs that support NMP files on Android.  Generally speaking, NMP is not a patch, but an internal format for a game modification application.  I don't know why some romhackers distribute hacks in this format rather than making normal patches.

google_play_reviews.content: Great tool if you want to apply ups or ips to your roms!
10/10 The only patcher app that bothers to tell me whats wrong.

It does exactly what it says on the box. The UI is simple and functional. 
The actual function of the app was fast and the outcome was successful. My 
only "complaint" would be that the file picker doesn't stay in the same 
directory between file choices, but my game and patch was in the same 
directory which may not be convenient for others. Or should I complain that 
this doesn't let me get infinite lives in FarmVille or whatever? Filter out 
all the "I didn't read the description" reviews and 3.9 turns into 4.8 
stars.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Thank you for the feedback!
The last opened directory is stored for ROM and patch separately. This is in case you have ROM and patches located in different directories. Also in the settings you can manually specify the directory that will be opened.

Not only that, but the application also make a new file which is the game that's successfully patched (with the tag [patched] at the end to indicate that the game has been patched), which is also a nice little feature. Overall, anyone here loves to play retro games with different elements other than original, then Unipatcher is for you! 5 Stars!

google_play_reviews.replyContent: You need ROM "1636 - Pokemon - Fire Red Version (U) (v1. 0).gba". Patch here https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/69192380/PokeSweets%20v1.0.ips
